div1.p: Reed gently upbraids his wife for not writing him daily and comments on the orchards.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [June 11?, 1902]
div1.p:
Did you write me
a letter yesterday? If you did, it
failed to arrive to-day: and if you
didn't, why didn't you? You musn't
leave your old Mr Mantee with-
out some word from his darling
babies, every day, and especially as
I had Magruder express to you 2
bottles of Wilson's -- “that's all” -- to-day-
I, also, took lots of trouble in getting
shipped via the B & O your 25
pieces of freight- I forgot the
Morris chair which is in my
office, but will have that sent up
soon- I enclose receipt and you
will see that I prepaid $4.15 on it-
I wonder if you had, this afternoon,
the splendid rain that fell here,
which cooled off the air so de-
lightfully after a very warm
day- I do hope that you did get
it- How are the locusts? Do pray
have Jacob keep them off my fruit
Trees- I went to see Dr & Mrs. For-
wood, last night, and he told me so
many interesting things about the
locusts. I not only had a pleasant
talk with them, but drank to their
healths in some good old “Rye”!
How goes on the work in the hall?
I expect to leave for Boston on the
4.50 Train tomorrow- I am afraid that
I can't get back in time to catch the 4.30
for Blue Ridge Saturday- Give much love
to the Ping-Pongers- Love & kisses, for
my precious babies-
